Title: libxslt: Execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis:
A vulnerability was found in libxslt, possibly resulting in the execution
    of arbitrary code and Denial of Service.

Background.Text: Libxslt is the XSLT C library developed for the GNOME project. XSLT itself is an XML language to define transformations for XML.

Description.Text: Anthony de Almeida Lopes reported a vulnerability in libxslt when handling XSL style-sheet files, which could be exploited to trigger the use of uninitialized memory, e.g. in a call to "free()".

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to process an XML file using a specially crafted XSL transformation file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All libxslt users should upgrade to the latest version:
